content.raw:
Thanks for reporting this! Please use the names listed in the documentation. It looks like there was an inconsistency in some of the early test examples, but the later [trial worlds released](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/Phase2_Task_Testing_2019) and the actual worlds used for phase 2 should match the documentation. 

We’ve created PR #217 to fix the inconsistency. Once it’s merged, everything should match \(you will need to pull the latest code and rebuild to see the change\). Please let us know if this does not resolve the issue for you.

I’ll also put up a forum post to clarify that the documentation has the correct name.
content.html:
Thanks for reporting this! Please use the names listed in the documentation. It looks like there was an inconsistency in some of the early test examples, but the later trial worlds released and the actual worlds used for phase 2 should match the documentation.

We’ve created PR #217 to fix the inconsistency. Once it’s merged, everything should match (you will need to pull the latest code and rebuild to see the change). Please let us know if this does not resolve the issue for you.

I’ll also put up a forum post to clarify that the documentation has the correct name.

content.raw:
Just to clarify…

* The "phase2" and "practice" worlds we released all use the non-underscore version and are consistent with the documentation.  I think that is 9 examples of the perception task that use identification strings consistent with the documenation.
* [PR #217](#!/osrf/vrx/pull-requests/217/fix-issue-189) - removes the underscore from a few[ earlier examples](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/vrx_tasks_2019#markdown-header-3-perception) so that they are consistent with the documentation.

I don't think it would warrant a forum post as that is likely to muddy the waters - we are staying consistent with the published documentation. Most of the examples are consistent with the documentation and we are not changing the documentation, so really a minor change.

Thank you @{557058:335cae63-ffdf-48a7-8317-496d75bc8f52} for pointing this out!

‌
content.html:
Just to clarify…

  • The "phase2" and "practice" worlds we released all use the non-underscore version and are consistent with the documentation. I think that is 9 examples of the perception task that use identification strings consistent with the documenation.
  • PR #217 - removes the underscore from a few earlier examples so that they are consistent with the documentation.

I don't think it would warrant a forum post as that is likely to muddy the waters - we are staying consistent with the published documentation. Most of the examples are consistent with the documentation and we are not changing the documentation, so really a minor change.

Thank you @John Sumskas for pointing this out!

content.raw: Hi @{557058:6c52d6e5-77e0-41a8-8b6e-cb9462f4d5f1} , just to clarify, for `perception world 1` provided in phase 2, the last 2 objects are red surmark objects but the the actual objects reported by the plugin are red\_totem, resulting in 0 score. Is this a typo? Not sure if this was clarified elsewhere. Just want to ensure that there is no issue with the way we are reporting our perception objects. Thanks
content.html: Hi @Brian Bingham , just to clarify, for perception world 1 provided in phase 2, the last 2 objects are red surmark objects but the the actual objects reported by the plugin are red_totem, resulting in 0 score. Is this a typo? Not sure if this was clarified elsewhere. Just want to ensure that there is no issue with the way we are reporting our perception objects. Thanks
